thread.title: Pappas Restaurant in Parkville temporarily closed following a fire
thread.title_full: Pappas Restaurant in Parkville temporarily closed following a fire

author: Sarah Meehan
title: Pappas Restaurant in Parkville temporarily closed following a fire
text:
Pappas Restaurant in Parkville temporarily closed following a fire Pappas File photo / Baltimore Sun 
A crab cake from Pappas, which is closed in Parkville after a Friday fire. The restaurant and sports bar is working to reopen by Friday. 
A crab cake from Pappas, which is closed in Parkville after a Friday fire. The restaurant and sports bar is working to reopen by Friday. (File photo / Baltimore Sun) Sarah Meehan Caption 'The Bachelor' recap: 'The Women Tell All,' aka the Corinne highlight reel 
“The Women Tell All” this week on “The Bachelor” - where many of the season’s contestants return after being sent home to face one another and Nick. 
“The Women Tell All” this week on “The Bachelor” - where many of the season’s contestants return after being sent home to face one another and Nick. Caption Bill Paxton’s cause of death 
TMZ published his death certificate on March 6. 
TMZ published his death certificate on March 6. 
The Parkville restaurant is located at 1725 Taylor Ave., next door to Pappas Seafood Co. (1801 Taylor Ave.), a seafood market that remains open. Pappas also has restaurants in Cockeysville and Glen Burnie, and recently opened a location at MGM National Harbor casino.
